data.event: Henry McHarg, president of the Texas Central Railroad, named the site in 1900 for his hometown of Stamford, Connecticut.

event.title: became one of the largest landowners in Texas, and by 1860

data.event: He became one of the largest landowners in Texas, and by 1860 his holdings in West Texas approached 500,000 acres (202,343 ha).

event.title: is headquartered in Stamford to this day

data.event: Later reorganized as the Swenson Land and Cattle Company, it is headquartered in Stamford to this day.
